page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: Over half the households in Youlgrave run one car privately and nearly a quarter run two cars. 14% run a firm's car. 30% have no car at all and rely on local bus services or friends as their main means of transport. Petrol costs Â£2.04 per gallon (48p per litre). Youlgrave is on two bus routes, one from Chesterfield to Matlock and the other from Middleton to Bakewell. From Bakewell connections may be caught to many major towns and cities. Youlgrave has 26 buses a day on weekdays. The first bus is at 07.00 and the last bus leaves at 22.25. It costs 55p to Bakewell, 80p to Matlock and 90p to Chesterfield. Silver Service have painted one of their buses black to protest against the Government privatising bus routes. The nearest railway stations are at Buxton and Matlock. Aidan Hodgkinson (10)
